titlealts.searchtitle: NHS Business Definition: Multidisciplinary Team Meeting - Description

div.p: A Multidisciplinary Team Meeting is a CARE ACTIVITY.
The following definition is used for the National Cancer Waiting Times Monitoring Data Set and Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set:
A Multidisciplinary Team Meeting is a meeting of the group of professionals from one or more clinical disciplines who together make decisions regarding recommended treatment of individual PATIENTS.

may specialise in certain conditions, such as Cancer. Clinical decisions are made based on reviews of clinical documentation such as case notes, test results, diagnostic imaging etc. The PATIENT may or may not be present.
